description: Sharik is an awesome program, very intuitive and powerful

This app is an excellent solution to file transfer on Wifi/ Hotspot between PC (esp. Linux) and Android devices. Install Sharik app on both devices. App image is also there for Linux. If only the mobile has the app, select the file to be send though the app, click send, then, open the http link on the screen in the PC browser and get the file instantly. Amazing app and a cute solution for speedy file transfer.
Please update this app to version 3.0.

I tried the commands given on Sharik's website. But my Debian machine did not allow me to go any further than installing snapd. The "sudo snap" "install core" and "snap install sharik" did not work. Then I decided to install the GUI snap. I was then able to install the app on my Debian Linux, but it wouldn't launch at all. Over all a lot of wasted time. I am still just relying on the USB cord to transfer files between my laptop and my android phone. I have even tried FTP and SSH clients - everything that I could get my hands on -; all to no avail. I hope you will fix this problem asap, because there is a real void here. When I had Windows 10 on my machine, I had a file manager on may android that had a very simple and easy to use FTP address that I could enter into my Windows file explorer and get full access to my phone's files. And with Ubuntu, Sharik worked fine, but there is nothing for Debian. Please fix your app, or tell me what to do.
Nice app, I am using this app to share files from android to linux.
Fonctionne parfaitement pour l'envoi de fichiers, mais la réception de nombreux fichiers n'est pas pratique (il faut les sélectionner/enregistrer un par un dans le navigateur)
